item.title: @elonmusk: A lot of posts criticizing Elon get massive reach on ùïè. If this was about controlling narratives, El...
item.description: A lot of posts criticizing Elon get massive reach on ùïè. If this was about controlling narratives, Elon would have limited the reach of posts attacking him. On top of that, recommendation algorithm on ùïè is open source, and no one, including Elon, is immune to Community Notes.

But Reid Hoffman barely gets mentioned despite having the deepest Epstein relationship and having lied about it. This is the protection that hundreds of millions of dollars in donations to the Democrat Party and anti-Trump lawfare buys you. NYT is a scumbag publication.

item.title: @elonmusk: For a while, I mostly ignored Elon‚Äôs narrative about Dems wanting to strategically import people to ...
item.description: For a while, I mostly ignored Elon‚Äôs narrative about Dems wanting to strategically import people to the USA to win elections. Just seemed too conspiratorial to me and not interesting. But after seeing all of the polling coming out showing overwhelming bipartisan consensus on voter ID laws, and still seeing big Dems push their ‚Äúvoter ID laws are racist‚Äù propaganda, it‚Äôs hard for me to ignore. It‚Äôs extremely odd to me how hard some Dems are pushing this agenda when almost none of their constituents want it. Why? If not to do something fraudulent, I don‚Äôt understand why. It‚Äôs obvious that most Americans don‚Äôt agree with their reasoning, but they are still trying for it. Insanely shady. Can‚Äôt think of any reason other than a desire to do something fraudulent. Nobody thinks voter ID laws are racist. It‚Äôs honestly way more racist to argue that minorities shouldn‚Äôt be expected to produce identification. Offensive af.

item.title: @elonmusk: Some gerrymandering stats for everyone. Going into this fight, Democrats in California get 58% of th...
item.description: Some gerrymandering stats for everyone. Going into this fight, Democrats in California get 58% of the vote, but their congressional maps were 43:9, or 83% democrats. Their new California maps will be 48:4, or 93% democrats. Illinois was 55% for democrats, but their districts are 14:3 for democrats, or 83%. Meanwhile, Texas was 56% for Trump, but 25:13 for their congressional seats, or 66% republicans. Their redistricting makes it 30:8, or 79% for republicans. Democrats in Virginia have taken a state that went 51-48% for Kamala, and redrawn a 6:5 (or 55% for democrats) and made it 10:1, or 91% democrats. No honest or thinking person can say the republicans are in the wrong here. As always with democrats, every accusation is an admission‚Ä¶ (And, if not for double standards, the Democrats would have no standards at all.)

item.title: @elonmusk: Elon Musk doesn‚Äôt lie and is always open to criticism. In the 2011 WSJ interview, Elon corrected the...
item.description: Elon Musk doesn‚Äôt lie and is always open to criticism. In the 2011 WSJ interview, Elon corrected the interviewer about Tesla‚Äôs government loan: ‚Ä¢ It was not stimulus money or a bailout. ‚Ä¢ Came from the ATVM program (created & signed by George Bush pre-crisis). ‚Ä¢ Tesla had to prove company viability independent of the loan (GM/Chrysler couldn‚Äôt qualify due to bankruptcy). ‚Ä¢ The ~$465M loan was specifically to accelerate Model S production (~$50k car, high volume), not to rescue Tesla. ‚Ä¢ Elon: ‚ÄúWe did not need the loan‚Ä¶ it was to accelerate progress,‚Äù and he‚Äôd accept criticism if it advances sustainable transport faster. ‚Ä¢ It included interest payments + government stock warrants if not repaid early. Other major recipients of the same ATVM loans (much larger amounts): Ford Motor Company received ~$5.9 billion, Nissan North America ~$1.45 billion. Fisker Automotive got ~$529M (later defaulted), and Vehicle Production Group ~$50M. Transparency on full display‚Äîbig legacy automakers got far bigger slices.
